This PR adds in a dynamic selection of the token index by using a mapping from the chainId to tokenIndex

prs.title: core/capabilities/ccip: fix nodes not supporting dest chain
prs.truncated_body:
Ticket: https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/CCIP-5321

The launching code has up until now assumed, for simplicity, that the
destination chain is always supported, since it would error if the node
doesn't have a chain writer for the destination chain.

This PR fixes that issue, so in the case where the node does not support
the destination chain, a no-op transmitter will be created. It m

commits.message:
core/capabilities/ccip: fix nodes not supporting dest chain

Ticket: https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/CCIP-5321

The launching code has up until now assumed, for simplicity, that the
destination chain is always supported, since it would error if the node
doesn't have a chain writer for the destination chain.

This PR fixes that issue, so in the case where the node does not support
the destination chain, a no-op transmitter will be created. It must be
noted that in such scenarios, the node should not be part of the
transmission schedule (the transmission schedule is generated by the
plugin dynamically based off of data in CCIPHome), though if it
erroneously is, all this would introduce is a delay and should not be
a fatal error, as long as there are sufficiently many nodes in the
schedule that can transmit to the destination chain.

address feedback

* add unit test for no op transmitter code path
* make logger names consistent across components
* change no op transmitter log from error to critical
* use HomeChainPollingInterval with jitter for launcher

prs.title: [CLD-268]: fix: populate new BlockChains field on cldf.env
prs.truncated_body:
As part of the migration to the new BlockChains field on the environment struct in CLDF, this commit popualates the chains into that field, eventually the dedicated chain field (evm, sol and aptos) will be deleted.

JIRA: https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/CLD-268

commits.message:
fix: populate new BlockChains field on cldf.env

As part of the migration to the new BlockChains field on the environment struct in CLDF, this commit popualates the chains into that field, eventually the dedicated chain field (evm, sol and aptos) will be deleted.

JIRA: https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/CLD-268

prs.title: op-e2e: simplify HF management in `NewL2FaultProofEnv`
prs.truncated_body:
`L1CancunTimeOffset` is enabled by default in [`ApplyDeployConfigForks`](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/31c94eec2c07e2a8f6f9511cde9dd1b2fb645ead/op-e2e/e2eutils/setup.go#L276)(called in `MakeDeployParams`), so there's no need to re-enable it in `NewL2FaultProofEnv`.

Besides, this PR eliminates the need for the switch case of HF by re-using `rollup.ForkName` as `Hardfork.Name

prs.truncated_body:
# Backport

This will backport the following commits from `main` to `release/v4.x`:
 - [feat(btcstaking,btcstkconsumer): Add max_multi_staked_fps validation and single FP per consumer constraint (#944)](https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/pull/944)

<!--- Backport version: 9.5.1 -->

### Questions ?
Please refer to the [Backport tool documentation](https://github.com/sorenlouv/backport)

commits.message:
feat(btcstaking,btcstkconsumer): Add max_multi_staked_fps validation and single FP per consumer constraint (#944)

## Description
https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/issues/412
https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/issues/900

Adds `max_multi_staked_fps` field to `btcstkconsumer` module and
validations in `btcstaking` module in `MsgCreateBTCDelegation`

### Changes
- (btcstkconsumer) Adds new field in `ConsumerRegister`,
`MsgRegisterConsumer`, and `ConsumerRegisterResponse` protos
- (btcstaking) Validations when a new delegation is created
(MsgCreateBTCDelegation) ensuring
   - atmost 1 FP per BSN
- number_restaked_fps <= min(max_multi_staked_fps_consumerA,
max_multi_staked_fps_consumerB, etc)
- Add/Update test cases in relevant files

### Next steps/related tasks
Bump babylon version and update assertions/tests in
https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon-rollup-integration-deployment

(cherry picked from commit 99972ffdf290e50d7cd96e0698758e24d13ceebc)

# Description

Implement a one-time fast-forward in the stateless client (bor-connected heimdall-v1) for tests by setting TotalDifficulty to the target block number on startup instead of fetching real TD and skipping formal validations. If it ever desyncs, simply restart to rerun the fast-forward.

# Changes

- [ ] Hotfix (change that

prs.title: go/p2p/peermgmt: Make consensus peer registry optional
prs.truncated_body: These changes allow us to create the P2P service without relying on the consensus. The service can now be instantiated upfront and shared with other components immediately. Previously, the light client could only be initialized lazily, after the P2P service was registered, which was not suitable for a stateless light node.

commits.message: runtime/common/sgx/pcs: Use specified timestamp for X509 verification

go/p2p/peermgmt: Make consensus peer registry optional

This change allows the P2P service to operate independently
of the consensus layer by discovering peers solely through
peer discovery mechanisms. Fetching peers from the consensus
registry is now optional and can be enabled if the consensus
service is available.

prs.title: runtime-sdk/consensus_accounts: Include shares and epoch in delegation events
prs.truncated_body:
- `DelegateEvent` also returns the amount of new shares received by the delegation.
- `UndelegateDoneEvent` includes the undelegation epoch.
- Added queries to return all {un}delegations

Made it optional so it's backwards compatible (old events can still be deserialized with the type).

Ensure Nexus deployments are updated first, before a paratime with this change is released.

prs.title: feat: add new authority actions for nano header
prs.truncated_body:
### Context

There are two new nano actions: grant authority and invoke authority. 

**Grant authority:** the transaction will give an authority for the contract, so we must add an authority utxo in the inputs list. The user might decide to create another output to keep the authority in a selected address.
**Invoke authority:** the transaction will get an authority from the contract to an add

fix: authority action types come as uppercase from fullnode
tests: add integration tests for authority actions
fix linter and use random wallet to authority ocb tests
refactor: use constant instead of hardcoded value
refactor: return objects instead of array of elements in the nano builder
feat: create schema subtypes for nano actions
refactor: move schemas to types file and remove duplicated types

prs.title: Merkle Proofs
prs.truncated_body:
This PR adds 
- the crypto utils necessary for merkle proofs verification
- support for sha256 and keccak hash algorithms, which wraps around those host functions
- proptests

A big part of it is inspired by the corresponding features in [OZ Stylus crypto lib](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/rust-contracts-stylus/blob/main/lib/crypto).
